availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Woodford County, Kentucky, physician. Kentucky native. Married to Kate Poynter. Resident of Bath County, Kentucky, in 1850. Graduate of the University of the City of New York School of Medicine in 1860. Assistant surgeon for the 24th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) from May 27, 1862, to February 7, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, District 2.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, Midway, p. 11.
“Catalogue of the University of the City of New York March, 1860” (New York: Hosford & Co., Stationers, 1860), 16.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 370.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 164.
Find A Grave, "Dr M. E. Poynter (1836-1889)," Memorial #97963977, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/97963977# (accessed July 12, 2018).
